content:
We can make our own website on http://[username].github.io/ for free if you have your GitHub account.
If you want to know more detail, please go to GitHub Pages.
This page is made by Hugo, which is one of the most popular OSS static site generators.
Hugo has many kind of themes and I choosed Academic. Academic is very functional, that is, there are many choices to customize, however, it is sometimes too much for me. That is why I take notes for some practical settings for my own in this page.
By using Academic, we can make pages from markdown, without setting HTML or CSS, because generators generates such kinds of files automatically.
Setting for menu bar Go to config/_default/menus.toml, and we can change setting for display, sequence, and link about items on menu bar such as Home, Posts, and so on.
Setting for bibliography Go to content/authors/admin/_index.md.
Setting for home page Go to content/home/*.md, and then we can change setting for display and so on. For example, in the case of posts.md, that markdown file interact with content/post/, and we can decide how many directories display.
Setting for [username].github.io/* For example, in the case of [username].github.io/post, go to `content/post/_index.md, and then we can change setting for title or subtitle on home page.
How to make new pages If you want to know detail, go to this official document. For example, in the case of making new post, type hugo new --kind post post/my-article-name in terminal, and then the new folder whose name is my-article-name is made automatically, so we can write contents on index.md in the folder. In this case, to show a new page in home, you go to content/home/posts.md and ensure active = true.
How to write technical content Go to official demo pages.
Setting for contact Go to config/_default/params.toml, and then we can change setting for our telephone number, our street address and so on.
How to check changes Type hugo server in terminal, and then hugo server starts and we can go to localhost:1313 for checking changes.
title: How to use Academic

content:
Welcome to Slides Academic
 Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides   Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E   Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")  Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = ;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
 Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}} Press Space to play!
One Two Three  A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears   Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}} Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view    Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links    night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links   Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}  Custom CSS Example Let's make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }  Questions? Ask
Documentation
summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
title: Slides
